Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
Any advice on how to decide between Komodo vs Verus to launch a blockchain?
Any important elements to consider when making the choice?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Komodo assetchain is cheaper for DPoW

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Verus will have meegemining

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Merge

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @D2D privacyalternatives.com from what I understand about VRSC, it will be limited to CCs approved by VRSC dev team. Other than that, it seems to be a very solid solution

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Also a "komodo assetchain" is really just "a really simple way to make a customized BTC fork". An assetchain doesn't have to be tied to KMD in any way, but this is not the case for VRSC's pbaas

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
One of the advantages of launching on Komodo would be that it can be done now, without waiting for the mainnet.
But there are some interesting things on Verus, like Merge Mining. In a video I watched there is also the Reserve mentioned, but have to research how that works.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: based entirely on what I've read about Pbaas so far, I think Pbaas will be easier to use and setup, but it will have a limited feature set compared to komodo based chains

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so easier to use, but less freedom in what you can do

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: OK

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the reserve thing mentioned in that video can be achieved on komodo asset chains as well

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: For a separate idea I have, I was wondering if it's possible to tokenise assets on komodo in a similar way to Ravencoin (but with extra features that come with Komodo such as privacy zk-snarks)

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: You can create tokens

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: TokenCC

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Not sure how privacy features work with it though

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: My idea would be to launch a project, and each token represents a share of the profits so it would be considered a security token. But I only like Komodo because it has privacy features, which I think are essential, nobody wants their money/coins/shares to be public I think.

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: There are many projects offering this, but none of them offer privacy features

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Tokens CC has no privacy features

Author: Alright#0419
Content: nor do any CCs as of yet

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you can simply create a blockchain with ac_private and use the base coin as the token

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you don't need to have the tokens on a separate blockchain

Author: Alright#0419
Content: K64 is an example of a "token" that is it's own blockchain. You could do something like this and just add zk-SNARKs(forced privacy or optional privacy)

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: Probably both, to offer a choice - some people care more about privacy, some might need full transparency for their needs

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do you need multiple tokens or only one?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: if it's a single token, it's dead simple to setup

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: A single token for a product

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: So Komodo can be as good as for example Ravencoin to create tokens backed by assets?

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: Because for Raven that seems to be their main focus

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: what about launching a private coin and do coin buyback burning with the profit instead?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: You can create your own token assetchain ( Your own ravencoin ) Or just use an assetchain coin for the ‚Äútoken‚Äù if you need only one

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: OK thanks

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
Coin buyback burning with the profit sounds interesting. I'm wondering what is easier in terms of legal matters.
As they said for Ravencoin, Polymath etc, it's easy to launch a token, but you still need lawyers for contratcs etc, it's much more complicated than just launching a utility token.

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
--
But that's for a separate project. My first question (Komodo vs Verus) was for a utility token
